title: The Hawaiian story of the wind keepers - Sydney Iaukea

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the Hawaiian wind goddess in the story?

options.label: A
options.text: La'amaomao

options.label: B
options.text: Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: Kuapaka'a

options.label: D
options.text: Keawenuia'umi

multiple-choice.question: What is special about Paka'a's skills?

options.label: A
options.text: He can only control the winds on land

options.label: B
options.text: He can only control the winds at sea

options.label: C
options.text: He can stir the skies and raise the waves by chanting the names of the winds

options.label: D
options.text: He is a skilled navigator

multiple-choice.question: Why did Paka'a flee from Hawaii Island?

options.label: A
options.text: He was seeking a new adventure

options.label: B
options.text: He was banished by the king

options.label: C
options.text: He was targeted by two of the king's seafaring navigators who were envious of his position and spread rumors against him

options.label: D
options.text: He was seeking a new wife

multiple-choice.question: What did Kuapaka'a do to earn the king's trust?

options.label: A
options.text: He built a new canoe for the king

options.label: B
options.text: He convinced the king to turn against Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: He maintained a vicious storm for four months, ensuring the king's safety and loyalty

options.label: D
options.text: He gave the king a magical fish

multiple-choice.question: What was the final challenge that Kuapaka'a set for the king?

options.label: A
options.text: A canoe race against the king's best fishermen, with a wager of his bones against theirs

options.label: B
options.text: A wrestling match against the king's strongest warrior

options.label: C
options.text: A test of the king's knowledge of the winds

options.label: D
options.text: A test of the king's loyalty to Paka'a

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the canoe race?

options.label: A
options.text: Kuapaka'a lost and the fishermen won

options.label: B
options.text: The race was a tie

options.label: C
options.text: Kuapaka'a won and the fishermen lost

options.label: D
options.text: The canoe sank and everyone drowned

multiple-choice.question: What did the king ask Kuapaka'a to do after the canoe race?

options.label: A
options.text: To have mercy on the fishermen who had lost the wager

options.label: B
options.text: To turn against Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: To become the new king

options.label: D
options.text: To return the magical fish

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the king's request?

options.label: A
options.text: Kuapaka'a refused and the fishermen were punished

options.label: B
options.text: The king agreed to Kuapaka'a's conditions and Paka'a's identity was revealed

options.label: C
options.text: The king was punished and Kuapaka'a's identity was revealed

options.label: D
options.text: The king and Kuapaka'a were both punished

multiple-choice.question: What was the final outcome of the story?

options.label: A
options.text: Paka'a and Kuapaka'a were both punished

options.label: B
options.text: The king and Paka'a were both punished

options.label: C
options.text: The king and Paka'a were reunited, and Kuapaka'a's identity was revealed, ensuring the names of the winds would never be lost

options.label: D
options.text: The story ended with a cliffhanger

multiple-choice.question: Who was the king of Hawaii Island in the story?

options.label: A
options.text: Keawenuia'umi

options.label: B
options.text: Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: Kuapaka'a

options.label: D
options.text: La'amaomao
